comm: proud upright seam first ball, swings away from a length, beats the outside edge of the defensive bat. Hardly any carry, though
short of a length, holds its line a little, defended off the back foot
leg-side half-volley, Finch misses out on a boundary. Gets just the leg-bye
tentative - and dare I say - nervous push at a length ball angled across him. No feet there. Beaten
fuller, on off, pushed between mid-off and cover for a single
on off, perfect length too, the ball angles in towards off and middle, defended to mid-on
half-volley, and Warner is away. Yadav bowls a loosener, on off, Warner just meets it with a full face. The mid-off is wide, and he gets four for this push
better length. Can't drive this. Can't go back to this. No swing, though. Defended off the back foot
on a length again, but this time Warner plays with an open face, and gets a single between mid-off and cover
slight shape away from the right-hand batsman. Finch plays watchfully. Towards cover

lovely delivery but no gully. This has opened Finch up. Wide on the crease, angling in, Finch looks leg side, but after pitching on a length this leaves him against the angle, and runs off the thick outside edge through the vacant gully region
short-arm pull for six. Warner not tentative anymore. Yadav pitches short of a length, and on the pads. Not a horrible delivery, but Warner loves this length. He has flick-pulled this over square leg
wide down the leg side as Shami tries to surprise Finch, who mush be expecting outswingers
another inswinger. Beats Finch's inside edge as Finch tries a big drive outside off. This is a full ball, but  just short of driving length

big lbw shout. Looks good on line, but it is bouncing over. Finch again looking for that away swing, and with the ball coming back in he ends up playing around the front pad. Just missing the top of the stumps, though
now he plays a proper defensive shot just outside off
another inswinger, and they are cramping Finch up. Hits his pad again, but headed down leg

another tentative loose shot. This is a wide half-volley, he goes for the big drive, but is early into the shot, and ends up dragging it to midwicket. The bat turns in his hands before the ball arrives
short of a length, outside off, left alone this time. More solid from Finch but an excellent over from Shami

India have struck early. The SCG has erupted. It looks like it is full of Indian supporters. Those six successive dots in the last over might have had a part to play in this. This is short of a length, but fuller than the one Warner smacked for six last ball. He is still looking to play that short-arm pull, realises that the shot is not on, and just checks it. An old-style bat, and this leading edge might have died, bit with the modern Kabooms it flies off the leading edge and settles with cover
full outswinger first up, around the fifth-sixth stump. That is the ball to bowl to Smith. This time, though, he opens the face nicely, and gets a couple past gully
short of a length, at the stumps, he shuffles across to defend
full, just outside off, this is the ball to bowl to Smith, but he is equal to it today, and shows it the full face with mid-off wide. Caresses this for four
short of a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
nonchalantly left alone as this one swings away from a length
beautiful shot. Shami overpitches. Finch just leans into it, shows it the full face, and sends it to the right of the stumps at the non-striker's end. Lovely straight drive.
big inswinger, a touch too straight, and he has picked it off the pads. Gets a couple fine of long leg
short of a length, wide outside off, left alone. Must have been tempting, this ball
length ball outside off, driven nicely, but straight to mid-off
another wide length ball, Finch realises he is not close to the line of the ball, and opens the face late to get a single to third man
tries the full leg-side yorker to look to go behind the shuffling Smith, but his bat comes down in time and flicks this away through midwicket
appeal for leg-before as this shortish ball beats the inside edge of the shuffling batsman. It is bouncing over the stumps
length-ball outswinger outside off. Smith lets it go through to the keeper
good ball. Late away swing from just outside off, but Smith recovers well, plays with soft hands, guides it wide of the slips for a single
full, fast, 149ks, on off, slight shape away, defended to mid-on
full outswinging yorker, at 148ks, beats him both for pace and the swing outside off
short, wide, Finch goes pull as opposed to the cut, and finds mid-on with it
full outside off, slight shape back in, pushed to mid-off
length ball, outside off, left alone. Again a bit of shape back in
on a length, around off, defended to mid-on
shuffles across to pull this short ball to long leg for one
full, shaping in, keeping him honest. Defended to mid-on
wide down the leg side as this one starts too straight and moves further down leg
on a length, pushed towards mid-on with a straight face
shuffles across, takes this from middle and leg, and works it away for a single
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
drives uppishly at a wide length ball, but it doesn't carry to point
moves across again, guides this to long leg for one
he is beaten for pace by this short ball. Hits it high on the bat as he looks to pull. Somehow manages to keep it down. Is headed for the ribs if the bat doesn't intervene
length ball outside off. Defended to point

he is not in control of this pull at all. Head-high bouncer, he is not looking at it, seems to have bailed out of the pull late, but the ball hits the semi periscope. Could have gone anywhere, but this has gone straight down towards deep backward square
fuller, straight, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, angling in, punched to mid-on
short of a length, this time he shuffles across to work this wide of midwicket for one
full outside off, just holds its line, left alone
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease

short of a length, wide, Smith lets rip, doesn't quite control it, but finds the gap between point and cover-point. Don't think this would have carried even if it had been hot straight at the man, but fair to say he wasn't in control of the pull
Smith hurts Yadav. Bowled short at 149ks, between waist and chest high, wide outside off, and he has drag-pulled it through midwicket. All along the ground. In full control of this pull
full this time, driven back down the ground, Yadav fields to his left
this is a limp short ball. Shows that Yadav is in his fifth over. Just waist high, Smith shuffles across, and pulls this through square leg to beat the man at short midwicket

this is ordinary bowling. India have used the bouncer well through the World Cup, but this is Australia, and they are not bowling it like they mean it. Only about rig high, and Smith shuffles across to pull it through square leg for four more. All along the ground
defends a length ball to leg
short of a length, at the stumps, bunted into the leg side for one
short of a length, at the stump, defended to leg
slower ball, on off, he picks it and defends
short of a length, at the stumps, worked to square leg
slower ball, short of a length, and again he finds that square leg with that flick. With a normal field Smith would have got at least a couple of singles so far
on a length, just outside off, defended watchfully
full inswinger, pushed to short cover for a crowd catch
length ball outside off, pushed with an open face to point
full outside off, driven to long-off
short this time, why are they feeding Smith? He loves it. Shuffles across, and pulls this through midwicket
full toss outside off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, he goes back to open the face, takes a single to the right of short third man
gentle-paced bouncer, only about chest high, and Finch has pulled this powerfully between deep backward square and deep midwicket. This will give Finch some confidence after a tentative start
short of a length, into the pads, works it fine of square leg for one
moves inside the line of a shortish delivery, gets a single to long leg
slower ball, on off, defended
on a length, angling in, defended to leg
missed put. This is down leg and a length ball. On another day Finch glances this for four eyes closed. Today he has not been at his best, and gets just one leg-bye
on a length, middle and leg, defended around the front pad
hits him pad but this is headed well down leg
moral victory for Jadeja as he has already made Finch take big risk. he backs away early, and cuts this from in front of the stumps for a single
down the wicket, right to its pitch, drives it to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, driven to the left of cover, and they get a single despite Rahane's dive here
down the wicket again, what looks like an on-drive for one ends up being a whip through midwicket as his wrists come into play at the last moment
short of a length, on off, he has somehow managed to place it wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep point for one
on a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
on a length, outside off, opens the face late, gets a single to deep cover
slower ball, short, punched away powerfully to deep cover
punched away to deep cover again
stays back to a length ball and punches this to deep cover
tossed up wide, he sets up a solid base, and smacks this drive powerfully through cover. This is bludgeoned. No niceties about it
this is middle and leg, doesn't turn, hits the inside half of the bat
overpitched, driven to long-on for one
on a length, holds its line, defended back to him
short of a length, punched away to deep point for one more
short of a length, punched away slightly to the right of third man where Shami's arm is taken on, and a couple secured
slower ball, full, on off, defended from the crease
full, on off, hits the inside half of the bat somehow
short of a length, middle and leg, worked away for a single
slower ball but if you bowl them so often, the short and wide delivery counts as a rank poor ball. Cut away in front of point for four
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
tossed up wide outside off, driven to long-on for one
wide half-volley, he plays for the non-existent turn, hits it off the outside half of the bat, to point
nice dip as he goes slower through the air. Defended off the front foot
short of a length, he goes back to cut, Ahswin is lucky he has found the fielder
this one turns back in to cramp him up, punched down to long-off for one
nicely tossed up wide outside off, some drift, some dip, creates the bat-pad gap, draws an inside edge, but he is safe
tossed up, middle and leg, defended back to Jadeja
pushed straight to the diving short straight midwicket. Dhoni doesn't like the effort. Wants Rohit Sharma to cut that single. "Two steps forward."
defended back to him
defended back to him as he bowls fast and straight
Kohli at short straight cover saves one with his dive. Dhoni likes this better than he did Rohit at short straight midwicket
clipped away off the pads to bring up yet another fifty against India. Smith loves them. They don't him. Fair to say
down the wicket, to the pitch of the ball, drives it to long-on
some dip from Ashwin, defended back to him
big slog sweep attempted, is beaten, but the bounce is taking this over. hence the muted lbw shout
leg spin almost in business. Short of a length, into the pads, goes back to whip it behind square, goes fine of that leg spin. Too fast for the man
short of a length, cut away, Ashwin is lucky Rohit makes the diving save at cover-point. Has saved three runs. Smith not happy he has not placed this perfectly
flighted around off, dips too, defended back to him
down the wicket again, right to its pitch, pushes this to long-on for one
stays back to a length ball, punches it to cover
stays back again as Jadeja pitches this up again. Can't do much with it
stays back again, Jadeja bowls length, he dabs on it, but can't beat short third man
flatter, into the pads, defended
full, overpitched, finally plays down the ground and gets a single to long-on
flat delivery, arm ball, punched to point
slower through the air, regulation offbreak, defended to leg

too short. This will release the pressure. The story of India's summer against Australia. They created pressure during the Tests too, but would release it with a bad ball. This is a bad ball. Short and wide, and is cut away for four
short again, the turn this time means he hasn't placed it well. Straight to cover-point
short of a length, turning into the pads, bunted into the leg side, and takes on Mohit Sharma's arm at deep backward square. Takes the second
nudges this offbreak around the corner for one
on a length, on the pads, dropped into the leg side for a single that takes the partnership to 100
punched down to long-on as he pitches short of a length
flat length ball, defended to leg

huge lbw shout, given not out, but Dhoni has gone against his instinct to review this. Finch is sweeping, is beaten, and the umpire reckons he is outside the line of off. Dhoni thinks the same too, but Jadeja is persistent that he has hit him in the line. Dhoni asks him where he hit him on the pad. Jadeja says the inside part of the bat. Dhoni finally gives in. You can see this is just a risk. Dhoni is not convinced about it. Replays show umpire's call. Desperate review. Wrong review
defended to leg for a single
driven down to long-on for one
lovely shot. Ashwin bowls a wide full ball, an offbreak designed to draw his bat away from the body, but he uses the wrists well to keep this drive down. Against the spin it goes, past the cover
pushed to long-on for one
pushed to long-on for another single
tossed up, slight dip, draws a defensive shot
short of a length, worked around the corner for one
tossed up outside off, pushed to cover
full, middle and leg, pushed to short midwicket
appeal for bat-pad catch, but this has lobbed off the flap of the pad. No bat involved
pushed to long-on

Smith has manufactured the length here. Sees the flat delivery early, this is not short, just short of a length, but he has gone deep into the crease to convert this into a short ball, and he pulled it with a vertical bat over midwicket. Excellent batting
and now he pushes one down the ground for one
this time he gets an inside edge onto the pad, but this has fallen wide of Dhoni
offbreak just outside off, defended with an open face
nice dip on this offbreak, he ends up pushing this to short straight midwicket

he has driven this into the stumps at the non-striker's end, and India are appealing for a run-out. First things first. Ashwin does get a touch on it as he dives, but Finch is alert. He is holding the bat in his left hand, and has gone back immediately as he sees a straight drive from Smith
short of a length, punched away to cover
driven to long-on for one
swept away from middle and leg, awkward slide from Mohit at long leg. A chunk of turn comes off as he slides vertically straight into the ground. Lucky he hasn't done any damage to himself
flat length ball, he stays back and punches, and finds cover-point
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
tossed up outside off, he presses forward to push this to deep cover to bring up a subdued fifty. A solid effort nonetheless. Full of character
driven down to long-off for one
overpitched on the pads, worked to long leg for one
lovely shot. A Mark Waugh shot without that elegance. Down the wicket, chips this over midwicket. Easy does it
tossed up, middle and leg, clipped away in the gap deep on the leg side. Rushes back for the second
swept away this time, but straight to deep midwicket, gets just the single
punches this down to long-on as Ashwin bowls flat
full, just outside off, turning in, defended off the front foot
some turn again, into the pads, he deflects it behind square, but finds short fine leg
Ahswin bowls shortish and flat, he goes back to cut, and is disgusted with himself at not finding the gap
short of a length, outside off, a little extra bounce, beats his punch
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
down the wicket, drives this length ball in front of deep cover for two
length ball, on the pads, chipped away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, into the body, punched to the right of midwicket for one
short, waist high, pulled between deep backward square and deep midwicket for two
tossed up, middle and off, pushed to short straight midwicket
swept away hard, takes a single to deep backward square
down the wicket to push this to deep midwicket
full, middle and off, pushed to short straight midwicket
short of a length, worked around the corner, but not wide of backward square leg
slower through the air, flighted around off, defended back to him
short of a length, straight, punched down the ground, straight of mid-on. A good start to the last 20 overs for Australia
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

that's close. Big shout for lbw. Short of a length, nips back in, hits just above the knee roll. It is hitting the stumps, but the impact seems outside off. Replays show umpire's call on impact and also that is only clipping the top of the stumps
full, low full toss, worked to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to third man for one
full, swept away from just outside off, gets a single to deep backward square
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
reverse sweep with no third man in place. Gets a couple
makes room to cut this from outside leg, Rohit Sharma misfields at point
reverse-sweeps, is beaten, but is hit outside the line of off
cuts from the line of leg again, but finds cover
short of a length, wide, punched away, but can't beat the man at backward point
short of a length, angling in to off, pushed back to the bowler
low full toss, Smith shuffles across, plays with a closed face, beats short fine leg. For a moment Shami thinks lbw is in business
short of a length, wide, beats the punch
length ball, angling in, he clears the front leg, and slogs this over midwicket for a six. Smith is slowly hitting that next gear

and there is the hundred. Poor bowling. Short ball, waist high. Bouncers get wickets. Just short balls don't. He drags this pull from outside off, beats short fine leg. Removes the helmet. Celebrates the hundreds. Keeps in with the tradition of Aussie Nos 3 standing up tall in big matches
India continue bowling short with no meanness or intent behind the balls. Finch makes room, upper-cuts it, and sends it over point for six. This could just be the turning point in this Finch innings
low full toss, driven to midwicket for one
makes room but drives this full toss straight to extra cover. Misses out
slower ball. Matters nowt. He has picked this early, opens the hip by clearing the front leg, and lofts this back over the bowler's head. The move-on is on. Too early to call a Smith double hundred?
short of a length, into the body, worked away for a single
low full toss, Finch gets inside its line, and provides it a ramp with his bat to launch it over short fine leg for four

India get the breakthrough. Smith won't score a double. Yadav bowls a bouncer that finally gets head high. Smith clears the front leg to hook. Doesn't control it. The top edge settles with deep square leg. Smith raises his bat to the crowd as he walks off
wide down the leg side. A rib-high short ball
wide down leg again as Yadav looks to tuck him up but misfires
angling in, beats the inside edge, concedes a leg-bye
four first ball for Maxwell. Length ball, into the pads, flicked away, square of fine leg. Easy pickings first up
wide down leg again. Yadav is trying to deny them room, but is bowling only down leg
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, wide, cut away to point
on a length, angling in towards off, plays this with soft hands, drops it towards cover, rushes through for one
Maxwell makes room, Shami bounces him, Maxwell tries to cut this down the ground (yes), and gets a top edge over the keeper's head
slower ball, short of a length, runs this down to third man
short of a length, at the hips, nicely glanced fine of fine leg. Yadav clumsy with the dive there. Ordinary ball, ordinary fielding
low full toss, drilled back at him, he gets a touch to it, but the deflection to midwicket yields a single
short ball, rib high, pulled away. Lucky to get away with it. Lucky it has gone straight to long leg
short again, rib high again, helped away for a single

big lbw shout as he plays across the line. The way Finch runs he is looking guilty. Kettleborough gets it right again. This is bouncing over. Finch, though, can be run out, but Raina misses from short cover
just a little short of a length, and Maxwell pulls this Ponting-style for four through long leg. Just helped along the way
oh more Ponting evoked here. This is an ordinary short ball, and he sets up the base to go back and pull this over midwicket for six
yorker outside off, dug out to mid-off
slower ball, but Maxwell picks it and backs away to drill it back over Yadav's head for four. This is pummelled. Absolutely pummelled
low full toss, makes room to slice it, but straight to Rahane at cover-point
length ball, offbreak, bunted to leg for one
slow through the air, well bowled. Dips a little. Maxwell is cramped by the turn. Defended back to him

Ashwin has bowled well, and he has got the big Maxwell wicket. Good field placings, good courage to bowl slow through the air. The ball turns into the pads, he cannot play it through the off side, and doesn't bother keeping the sweep down. Straight down the lap of deep backward square it goes
tossed up, middle and leg, worked ton short fine leg
flat, short of a length, punched, but can't beat point
flat, into the pads, worked away square for one
short, outside off, short-arm pulled to midwicket

good sharp short ball. India are clawing back. They could still keep Australia down to a manageable total. Only Yadav has been able to hurry the batsmen with the short ball. Finch is hurried into this again. This is just outside off, chest high, and does him for the pace. The edge is taken, and caught at midwicket. A hard-working team-man innings from Finch comes to an end
pulled away for one to deep backward square leg
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover off the back foot
wide down the leg side. Kettleborough not affected by the appeal for the catch
forward-defensive as he pitches on a length
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, flat, straight, worked away for a single around the corner
full, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for one
flat, short of a length, punched down to long-off for one
shimmies down the wicket, Jadeja slows it down a little, Clarke defends to leg
another shimmy, and another forward-defensive
square-drive a wide length ball, Jadeja dives to his wrong side at point to save three runs
bouncer, good bouncer, higher than the shoulder, Clarke pulls out of the pull
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man for one
wide length ball, he stays back to cut, but finds the man at point
bouncer again, and again he gets it higher than the shoulder. He withdraws from the pull. Two good bouncers this over
half-volley outside off, crunched away, but straight to mid-off
and there is the boundary. A length ball, fired into the pads, he uses all the pace of the ball, and chips it over midwicket for four
slower through the air as Clarke shimmies, gets some turn, draws a defensive shot
fired into the pads, this time he has a fielder on the boundary in front of square on the leg side. Gives away just the single
flat and straight, no room, pushed to cover
makes room to punch this length ball to long-off for one
length ball, into the pads, dropped into the leg side for one

another wicket for India. This is a soft dismissal. A little luck for them. This is a short ball. Not a bouncer. No menace behind this. Only waist high. Clarke can see a four over midwicket, but just doesn't get the elevation he desires. Finds Rohit Sharma there. This is what a break in momentum does to you. Slight uncertainty, and a boundary ball has resulted in a catch in the infield
short of a length, on off, punched to extra cover
short of a length, no room, has hit the bat as opposed to the bat hitting the ball. Heavy ball. Hits the shoulder of the bat as he defends
on a length, tails in towards off, pushed to mid-on for one
low swinging full toss, clipped to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, pretty straight, defended to leg
on a length, no room, he defends to short midwicket
down the wicket, beaten in the flight as this dips on him, flicked to that midwicket again
flatter, quicker, pushed to cover. No run again. Pressure. Excellent from India
down the wicket, not to its pitch again, drives this wide of long-off for two
looks for the big hit down the ground, but Ashwin is bold, slower through the air, getting the ball to dip, creating the gap between its pitch and Watson's reach. Defends

and there is the Watson slog sweep. This can get his innings going. Finally Ashwin goes flatter. Possibly to protect a good over. Watson likes it that he has pitched it within his reach. Sends it sailing over midwicket
short of a length, straight, worked to leg for one
slower length ball, Watson has picked the field well with no sweeper back on the off side, and he makes room to go over cover. Not the best connection, but clears the infield
that's lucky runs for Faulkner. Good bouncer from Shami, gets it shoulder high, Faulkner looks to drag it from outside off, gets a top edge over the keeper's head
this short ball is not that great. A bit tired really. This is only chest high, and he has pulled this between deep backward square and long leg
makes room, Shami follows him up with the endangered species - the yorker. Just the single off the inside edge
another yorker, tailing back in, following him, kept out by Watson, but the desired result for India: a dot ball
Faulkner the finisher. Faulkner the party pooper. Slog-sweeps this flat over midwicket for six. Hits the gloves that are left to dry there
makes room to expose the cover field as India strengthen the leg-side field. Raina, though, makes a diving save at cover to save three runs
Watson looks for a slog sweep this time, gets an inside edge into his back pad. Credit Jadeja for pulling the length back
bowls a round-arm fast ball outside off, hurries Watson up. Another dot
clever bowling. Sees Watson backing away, and fires in a wide yorker. Well bowled
another flat fast delivery wide outside off, this time Watson drives it to deep cover for one
nails this punch to deep midwicket. Gets a single
full, just short of the yorker length, and he has slogged this straight of deep midwicket. Amazing how he keeps missing the fielders

Faulkner goes after that cameo. Yadav bowls full and straight. Fuller than a length ball, just short of a yorker. Faulkner swings across the line to go over the leg side. Misses it altogether as it tails back in. Timbah
lovely yorker as Haddin makes room. Right on the crease. Dug out by Haddin, but that is a perfect delivery
short of a length, quick, no room, 143ks still, Haddin is making room but is cramped
Haddin is usually stylish down the ground, but this is just power. No elegance, just effectiveness. Makes room to drill this full ball straight of mid-on
makes room to drive a length ball wide of cover for four. The worst ball to bowl at this stage is length
slower ball, has him there, Watson has to check that slog, but the top edge somehow clears square leg. Lucky for Watson
short ball, but not the Yadav variety. Easy to pull this as there is hardly any nasty pace behind this. Pulls this wide of deep midwicket. Now he reaches a run a ball
well bowled. A yorker outside off as he sees him back away. Dug out to point

slower ball, in his slot, this time he has picked the slower ball, but he has cramped him for room, and his slog settles with deep square leg. Just can't get enough power behind this shot because there is no rook available
slower ball, Haddin reads it late, but opens the face to get a single to short third man
this is in the slot. Half-volley outside off. Haddin has mis-hit this. Another dot. Straight to mid-off

that mid-off nearly takes a catch. Haddin mis-hits a full ball again, but it bounces just short of mid-off. The single takes them to the first-ever 300 in a World Cup semi-final. Will we see another later this evening?
but he is not bowling to his field. The field is there for the short ball, but he bowls length, and Johnson carts him over wide mid-on for four first ball

he bowls short, according to his field, but Johnson has made room to pay an exceptional shot. He has punched this over wide mid-off. Yadav chases well, but inn the end the slide is clumsy, and Johnson gets four
now that the third man comes in and mid-off goes back, Shami bowls the shortest ball of the over, and Johnson's top edge clears short third man
yorker, middle and leg, but Johnson has dug it out for one
slower ball, on a length outside off, he mis-hits it, but the bunt goes into the on side with no man inside the circle. Gets a couple
another slower ball, this time he has hit it harder towards deep midwicket. Won't get the second
another slower ball, hit towards deep midwicket, Kohli charges in, gets both hands to it, but drops it. Warner seen clapping that from the balcony
full toss with mid-off up not the best ball to bowl. Has missed the yorker in all likelihood. Drilled over mid-off for four
this was telegraphed. Johnson was expecting the slower ball, and he has drilled it flat, and between long-on and deep midwicket. Flat six to cow corner
short of a length, at the body, no room, they get just a single
super start from Starc, not full enough to drive and nibbling back from outside off stump, beats an expansive drive from Rohit
good carry for Mitch 2.0, climbing off a length in the channel, Rohit draws his bat inside the line
probing away around off stump, fast and bouncy from Starc, defended sharply off the back foot

full now, driven without foot movement - and taken. Or is it? There's a question of whether this carried, Watson did not seem all that sure at slip. Big edge from Sharma, only just after the ball had pitched, which confused things a touch... Erasmus is checking various replays, looks like there's some grass involved. Foreshortening, yadda, yadda... The replay from behind certainly introduced some doubt, so it goes back to the on-field umpires: not out
pitched up again, in the slot and this time Rohit spears it through point, in the air for a moment but beat the fielder
length and sliding across, squares the batsman up and takes the edge again, bounces short of Clarke at second slip this time
slightly short, not quite the width Dhawan wanted but he still gets a firm cut away, well fielded at backward point, taking the pace off it and they amble one
length ball in the channel, 140kph and holding its line just a tad, Rohit shoulders arms
very tight to off stump but Rohit is confident he knows his geometry and leaves again
goodish length, angled in and blocked over the top of off stump
fluffs the pull but this flies beyond Haddin scampering away to his left... Got hurried by the short ball and gloved wide of the wicketkeeper, just enough on it and they pick up two
too straight but Rohit misses with a flick to leg, thuds into the pads and drops down on to the pitch
slightly full outside off, Dhawan pushes at it from the crease, gets an inside edge on to his pads
fired in on the stumps, quite full and tailing towards leg, Dhawan tucks it away behind square
lets this go early, low full toss from Starc, which Rohit slashes down to third man
on a length and homing on off stump, comes forward and taps into the off side

Starc is revving at 150kph, steaming in and wanging the ball down around off, blocked back to the bowler, who picks up and attempts to look menacing... But Starc is a big ole puppy dog, we all know that
strays on to the pads, flicked firmly but straight to Maxwell at square leg
good length in the channel, comes forward and plays into the ground towards cover point
touch short and seaming back at Rohit, works it off his body and into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
banged in short, in the arc and Dhawan dispatches it through midwicket, went off the middle like a rubber ball

edged and dropped by the diving Brad Haddin! Dhawan had skipped down the track, playing on the up and a big edge flew between keeper and slip, Haddin made the choice to fly after it, got both hands to the ball but was unable to cling on
touch short and wide and Dhawan slashes a toe-ended cut down to point
tighter line and dug in short as Sharma moves across and plays no stroke
length delivery around off, comes forward and taps into a gap in the covers
back of a length outside off, no stroke
shortish and whipped away through midwicket, big roars go up around the ground as they scamper three
very short and climbing high over the batsman, might have been lucky to get away with that one

now goes for the yorker, veers in dangerously late and tonks Dhawan on the boot, Dharmasena shakes his head at the lbw appeal... and then an attempt at a run out from point gifts India an overthrow. Australia think about the review but pass
short ball and left alone once again
slightly back of a length in the channel and Dhawan stays back, runs one to third man
shortish and ducking back at Sharma, hit on the padding and they hustle one, as Hazlewood tries to get to the ball in his follow through. The umpire comes in quickly to break up any potential afters
in the corridor, where Dhawan is known to go knocking on doors, swish and a miss from the moustachioed maestro
shortish, 142kph and stabbed into the off side form the crease
length around the line of off, half forward and takes a leading edge, falls short on the off side
pitched up a little further, Dhawan uses those dancing feet, spikes a couple more into a gap through the covers
slung down in the channel, sliding across outside off like a shark in the shallows, left alone
banged in and rising at the batsman's head, Rohit meets fire with TNT and hooks Johnson for six well over fine leg! No problems with that short ball, saw it early and scooped it into the crowd
length ball around off, goes across and defends down on to the pitch
in the channel, shuffles across to cover the line
length ball, around off stump, tries to drive on the up, bat turns in his hands and mid-off comes across to cut it off
up towards 150kph from Johnson, grooving his action, Rohit dabs to the off side - just the one scoring shot off the over but it was a goodie
fired across the bows, played down gently
dug in short and pulled away, wide of fine leg but it went quickly and they only manage a single
coming back in and Rohit plays with the angle to the leg side, another single
length delivery outside the line of off, opens the face and runs the ball away behind point
Hazlewood continues to plug away in the channel, diligent stuff, Rohit dabs it towards point
tight line around the off stump, hinting at a touch of seam movement in, Rohit shows it a solid front-foot block
Johnson is going around the wicket, Dhawan backs away and steers a length ball through the covers for a couple, nicely timed
hammers in and hits the middle of the pitch, Dhawan stays back and guides in front of point
silky from Dhawan, he's more than happy to let Johnson fire the ball across him, lovely hands as he slices the ball elegantly between two fielders, four to the deep point boundary
goes back over the wicket, very full, not quite the yorker but swinging late, takes Dhawan on the pads
pitched up and tailing in, punched back to the bowler as he comes forward
goes across his stumps and blocks a length delivery
length around off stump, defended... but Jimmy F has overstepped
pitched up, Rohit shapes to smash a home run, bottom edges one through backward square leg
advances to a length ball and plays and misses... steady
length delivery outside off, Dhawan walks out and larrups four through the covers, confidence of the man and that whistles away
fuller, becomes a half-volley to Dhawan and he punches wide of the diving mid-foff, that's going to the rope too
too straight, innocuous pace from Faulkner, picked up and deposited into the stands! Dhawan has taken a liking to Faulkner, whips this waaaaaaayyyyyy over deep midwicket
drags this wide of the stumps, comes forward and dabs the ball square, this time it's reeled in
pitched up across the right-hander, who punches through the covers
fullish length, Dhawan moves on to off stump and clubs the ball through square
outside the line, goes across and plays into the covers
ripping bumper from Johnson, not all that short but it flew through at throat height outside off, Dhawan drops the bat in time
slings this down the leg side... wide
veering towards leg stump again, 147kph and thumps the padding as Dhawan attempts to flick to leg
good length around the line of off, Rohit seems to have all the time in the world as he leans out to defend
four! Driven through the line, too full from Faulkner and pinged back whence it came, bowler got a finger to it but there was no stopping the ball
goes short, good rising delivery that cramps Dhawan as he hooks and misses... but was too leg side for Kettleborough's liking
another four down the ground, Dhawan is on a Faulkner hunt! Charges at the bowler and rattles a short-arm jab fine of mid-on this time
good length outside off, this time Dhawan elects to let it go
dug in, doesn't get up all that high, rattled through backward square on the pull, straight to the fielder
touch straight and Rohit paddles one behind square
back of a length outside off, delicate late cut from Dhawan this time, gets it very fine and they're able to scuttle two as third man runs around to field
down the leg side and there's a flick of the pad, Haddin appeals vociferously but correctly not given
comes across and  punched back on the on side
short ball, Rohit hooks off his nose, gets under it but there's enough heft to clear midwicket for a couple
stays back and deflects one from outside off down to third man

here comes Shikhar... and there goes Shikhar! He's absolutely skelped this but sends the ball straight into the safe, safe hands of Glenn Maxwell at deep extra cover! Hazlewood roars, clenched fist pumping, they've got their opening. Pitched up outside off, maybe slightly off the toe as Dhawan drove over the infield, only one man out there but it flew to him like a homing pigeon
dug in outside off, climbing as the batsman ducks out the way
starts with a short ball, rising towards the rib cage, defended from the crease
slammed in short again, Kohli gets above it and steers towards point
fuller outside off, leans out and steers in front of point, can't get it through the infield
goes short again, over the stumps, hops back into position and defends
pitched up, this is a slower ball, Kohli is on the front foot but mistimes a push back towards mid-off
slanted across the right-hander, on a length, opens the face and glides a single to third man
Hazlewood metronomes away on a length around off, gets across and defends from the crease
this is an excellent display from Hazlewood, gets a bit of extra bounce this time, tempting line and Kohli fends at it, as he is wont to, misses the outside edge
straighter, not full enough to get to the pitch, turns it short to the leg side
length in the channel outside off, above 142kph and pushed defensively into the covers
goodish length outside off and tapped into the off side from the crease again
chastity-belt tight from Hazlewood, ducking back on off stump, Kohli defends down the pitch - maiden of the purest variety
slightly back of a length, drops into the crease and blocks
drops short, takes the pace off as well, Rohit wheels around and bottom-edges a pull behind square

bouncer from Mitch, top-edged and gone - Kohli has cracked! Slow start, quick end for Virat, took on the Johnson short ball and emphatically lost. It was aimed across him, outside off, attempted to pull and sent a lusty blow straight up, Haddin had time to do a little square dance to his left, opened up the gauntlets and swallowed India's star man
starts with a snorting lifter, this eye-balled Rahane from close range, jerks his hands up and does well to fend it away to the leg side for a single
fuller length in the channel, Rohit leans out and strokes to point, who's on it in a flash
shortish, at the body, Rohit stays back and dabs it comfortably behind square for one
slightly full of a good length, gets out to meet it but can't to much beyond block towards cover
touch shorter, outside off, stays back and guides one down to third man
over the top of off stump, Rahane gets forward and blocks into the covers
tight line around off, hops back and across, dabs short towards point
super ball, slightly back of a length but it spits out of the fire and clatters the handle of Rahane's bat as he fends at it in front of his face
fuller now, in the channel, Rohit is hunkering down in the trenches while Hazlewood is on, defends into the covers again
shortish, doesn't get up, Rahane sits on it and blocks down on to the pitch
vicious bumper, Johnson is whirring in, aiming at the top of little ole Rahane's block, he flails at it, manages to stab it into the ground past the catcher for a single to get off strike
fuller length, pushed across, steered through the covers for one
short and angled towards the slips, punched off the back foot through cover, played that better, did Rahane

short ball and that's a Dorothy for Rohit! Mitch is not going to have it all his own way... Rohit puffs up his chest in response and flat-bats the ball well in front of square, long ball into the crowd

bowled him, Johnson strikes back! He leaps up to the skies in celebration, Australia's spearhead has taken out another key batsman, fast and furious, right through Rohit, off the inside edge and lighting up the wicket. Held cross seam, nipped back at pace and clipped the leg bail. Lights are going out for India
full and straight, Rahane covers up in defence
good, tight line, offering nothing as Rahane gets in line once more
back of a length over the stumps, Rahane stays in the crease and defends
pushed a little wider, 147kph/91mph and stabbed towards backward point
nicely played by Rahane, touch full and he times this back past the bowler and they pick up a couple
tickles 150 kays, drops back and runs one more behind point
tossed up outside off stump, gets in line to defend
angled in, works with the spin to the leg side
quicker and flatter outside off, touch of spin, played back to the bowler from the crease
drops short and Rahane rocks back to pull, hard and flat but straight to deep backward square
goes around the wicket, pushed through and played towards mid-on, no run
gives this a bit more air, tossed up outside off, Raina reaches for the drive and inside edges past his stumps
steams in and bangs out a drumbeat halfway down, Rahane rides the bounce well
short again, rising at Rahane's face like a seagull swooping on a stray wotsit, pulls and misses, there's an appeal behind the stumps but no glove involved
angled across, not so short and steers one through the covers
good length, veering back in at the batsman, shows it a stout defensive stroke on off

full length and punched straight back tot he bowler, Starc then tries to throw down the stumps, hits Raina on the pads... Starc appeals for something, Raina thinks about a run. Nothing actually happens
slung down very short and called wide... Starc follows through to spit some opinions in Raina's direction. Getting a wee bit feisty out there
fires this well down the leg side, Raina right back on his stumps - another wide
full and straight, Raina is equal to it once again
slightly short and outside off, swipes at it and a thick edge falls short of backward point
flat on the stumps, worked away for a single through the leg side
goes around the wicket, punched into the covers and there's a misfield, Rahane wanted a second but Raina was dawdling
angled in with the arm, turned off the pads, can't get it through
tossed up, bounce a touch and swept in the air, lands short of fine leg
stays back and works another single off the pads
lands this on a full length outside off, mistimes drive top mid-on from Raina
length in the channel, stays in the crease and opens the face, runs one to third man
sliding across on a length outside off, Rahane punches into the covers off the back foot
tighter to the stumps, waits on it and nurdles one through square leg
uh oh, Faulkner's copybook picks up another big fat blot, easy pace on a length and Raina whips it off the stumps away through midwicket

dangles the bat at a short ball, nicks it through to Haddin! India are four down and swaying in the evening breeze! Some redemption for Faulkner, who hit the pitch hard with another cross-seam delivery, got bigger than Raina was expecting, wanted to run it down but just succeeded in steering to the keeper. Soft, squidgy dismissal but Faulkner doesn't care, he's cock-a-hoop
pushed through on off stump and played back to the bowler
comes forward and plays back past the bowler
on the stumps, flat trajectory, dabbed back to the leg side
outside off, no turn, Dhoni off the mark with a push through the covers
pushed through outside off, steered towards the point fielder
flat and on middle stumps, turned off the pads to the man at square leg
good length, in the channel from over the wicket, left alone
little bit of width, Dhoni drives airily and gets a thick inside edge behind square on the leg side
slightly full, around off stump, reaches to drive to mid-off
tighter line and Rahane drops this down defensively on to the pitch
on the stumps, stays back and works a coup,e through midwicket
excellent running again, softly dropped this behind square and hared back for a second as deep midwicket ran around and the throw came in
tossed up on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
flat, with the arm, worked wristily from middle stumps through midwicket for one
full around off stump, Dhoni shuffles forward and pushes another single down the ground
slightly short outside off, waits on it and chops through cover point
tossed up a bit further, gets on the front foot, reaches to steers  through the covers to the sweeper again
flat on the stumps, Maxwell kicks the turf as Rahane works this back to long-on for another single
good line around off stump, gets forward to meet it
offers some width, Rahane opens the shoulders and slaps a length ball through the covers
a chance? No, not quite... The camera reeled like a drunk on deck during a storm as Dhoni pulled a short ball, just managed to keep it down as it flew towards Warner patrolling deep square leg
on the stumps, dabs to the leg side and they pinch one more
goes back in the crease and gets a thick outside edge wide of the sole slip
good line on off stump, played back to the bowler
on the stumps, tapped back to the bowler
makes some room, this was flat outside off and he plays it late, wide of short third man for a couple
comes forward and pushes through the covers
tossed up on middle and leg, leans out and flicks it around the corner to fine leg
angled in with the arm and worked away into a gap
flat on the stumps, Rahane stands tall and punches to Maxwell's right, he skips after it and pounces to prevent a single
starts on a length outside off, Dhoni attempts to helicopter it down the ground, gets a thick outside edge and it flies towards third man, lands safely again
drags it back a touch, plays from the crease towards point
good line on off stump, blocked back down the track
Hazlewood is woodpeckering away outside off, Dhoni tries to force it off the back foot, the ball rolls to cover
drops a little short, at the body, pulled into the ground for a single to deep square
finishes on the same parsimonious, fourth-stump line he has bowled all night, blocked to point
short and rising sharply enough to catch Dhoni off guard, hits the body and drops to the turf, they take a comfortable leg bye
worked off the pads through midwicket for one
touch short outside off, pushed back into the covers
goes fuller, off-stump line, Dhoni steps out like a guardsman on parade, dead-bats it to mid-off
in the channel, shuffles across and flicks the ball away behind point for a single
Watson bends his back, the short ball rises at Rahane's grill, he whaps it through backward square with a horizontal bat, easy two there
smashed down the ground, Dhoni puts a dent in the Hazlewood saloon, slightly full and Dhoni skipped forward to muscle a drive past the umpire, Dharmasena had to bail out there
goes shorter, stays on that line outside off, swatted through the covers for one
on the stumps, tries to turn off his body, can't get this away
angling in off a length, defended into the ground
straighter line, goes across and whips a single through square
gets out the carving knife and cuts another slice, this one has some luck about it, shorter length from Hazlewood and slashed on the up over slip for four more
Rahane was walking across his stumps, Watson fires it a whisker past leg, batsman misses but the umpire is happy with it
fullish, around off stump, check-drive from Rahane, nicely played but straight to mid-off on the bounce
cutter from Watson, Rahane pushes into the covers
pitched up around off stump, tries to drive but can't get it past mid-on, struggling for timing here
shorter and Rahane swipes across the line, it's in the air but bounces a fair way short of deep midwicket
full length outside off, little bit of width, Dhoni bunts it through the covers along the ground
starts with a low full toss, quite wide and Dhoni struggles to reach for it, chops to backward point
straighter line, working up his pace, turned through a gap at midwicket
sprayed across the right-hander from over the wicket, shapes to play but doesn't pull the trigger - wide
reaches for the drive and it flies wide of slip, streaky boundary for Rahane, his first of the innings, beaten for pace but he flung the bat hard and got away with it
over the stumps, drops back and plays down the track
fullish, slightly leg side, flicked away through backward square with a turn of the wrist, to the man in the deep
hits the deck, rising above middle and leg stump, Dhoni drops it down on to the pitch and Johnson collects
pitched up and Rahane is on the attack, skips out and lofts this down the ground, a genuine stroke for four this time
full and tailing in, comes forward again, this time elects to push back to the bowler
short and scrambled, backs away and slashes hard at the ball outside off, misses it completely
touch back of a length outside off, plays this deftly off the face of the bat, fine of third man for a couple
dug in and Rahane hooks wildly, not in control but, because he clothed it, the ball didn't reach fine leg
good length on off stump, Dhoni happily chops through point for a single
length ball, driven on the up and Dhoni sets off immediately, putting pressure on the man in the covers, they steal a base
clever from Johnson, angled across and just cutting his fingers over it, takes the pace off and Rahane fishes, narrowly avoids feathering it through to Haddin
straighter line, works the ball away through square leg
back of a length, Dhoni pokes it is like an old geezer stoking the fire, hits high on the bat and runs into the covers
shortish, gets behind it and drops one more down beside the pitch
fullish outside off, Rahane throws the hands and slices over the infield, behind the man in the deep but Starc runs around and makes a good sliding stop
wide of the stumps, maybe a cutter, Dhoni swings leadenly at it, fails to connect
goes very full and wide, reaches out and steers a single through the covers
on the walk, outside off, Faulkner again runs his fingers over it, Rahane dabs and misses
on the stumps, shuffles to off and flicks behind square, the man on the 45 doesn't field it cleanly and they get one
superbly placed, picked the full, wide delivery and sliced it in front of the diving point fielder, the backspin then takes it away from deep cover running around
on the stumps, goes deep and works one more to the leg side
over the wicket, fullish around off stump, dobbed into the ground towards mid-off, who's back a touch and they take one comfortably

Rahane plays with fire, fiddling at a length ball off the back foot... it slides past the outside edge. No one reacts but Australia then decide to review, not sure on whose prompting. Looks like a gamble, but... While there's no visible deviation, a thin scrape on Snicko is enough for Erasmus, he tells Dharmasena to overturn his decision. Australia have rolled the dice and come up trumps! Quite what Rahane thought he was doing, I don't know, hugely risky and he walks off without a backward glance

full and homing in on the stumps, maybe sliding too far to leg as it thumps the pad and Dharmasena turns down Starc's appeal. Finch, fielding at short leg, then hits the stumps for good measure but Jadu was home
short ball, tries to cut off the back foot, gets a bottom edge behind square
pitched up, punched back to the bowler
full and straight and whipped off the pads, flies along the ground to the fielder on the ring - which is lucky, because fine leg was up
nip-backer from Faulkner, this hits Jadeja on the pads, probably a touch high
over the wicket and at the stumps, worked to the leg side
angled across, chopped off the back foot behind point, collected on the move but they still get one
slightly short, in the channel outside off, punched into the ground but straight to backward point
short ball, tries to hook it and gets a bottom edge past the wicket behind square on the leg side
slower ball, Dhoni calmly pats it through square on the leg side
length, slightly leg side, flicks the pad and runs fine, Dhoni sets off with two in his mind and Watson's lethargic pick up makes sure he will get them
stays back, rides the bounce of a back-of-a-length delivery, drops one into the covers
zinging back in off a length and Jadeja is beaten on the inside again, thumps the thigh pad and squirts away
pitched up in the channel, driven to the man at cover on the edge of the ring
attempted yorker, it's actually a low full toss but Dhoni can only block it into the turf, loops back towards mid-off
full and fast but reversing down the leg side - would have been a wide if Jadeja had not got some wood on it, runs quickly to the long-leg boundary
fullish, outside off, Dhoni cuts and gets a bottom edge into the ground
cuts this away from the batsman, in the channel, reaches out and steers a single
tight line around off stump, Jadeja shows it a solid straight bat in defence
back of a length, works this one off his hips, they think about two but won't get the second
fullish, another change of pace from Faulkner, crouching walk forwards and pushed to mid-off, one more
angled in and played with a straight bat into the leg side for another single
angled across the lefty, slightly back of a length, stabbed into the covers and two men converge on it quickly
straighter line, stays back and works the ball into the leg side

pulled but it flies high, towards the edge of the ring, but Clarke drops it on the run! A life for Dhoni and how crucial could that be? Big top edge as Hazlewood cramped him for room, Clarke made the ground really well, got his hands under it but allowed it to pop out
short again, Dhoni had retained the strike, pulls this flat down towards fine leg
bit of width, four for Jadeja, stayed back and cut the ball with a rapier flash through point, wide of the third man
goes back and across and defends a length ball - Hazlewood finishes with 1 for 41 from 10. But he'll wish he had Dhoni, too
length in the channel and Dhoni spears it through square
wide of the stumps, backs away and chops one more down to third man
charges in, this is full and wide of the stumps, throws the bat but mistimes it into the covers, still gets one
continues on a full length, not quite hitting the yorker, this tails on to the pads and Jadeja flicks it to fine leg

called for one, direct hit from Smith and Jadeja is struggling... Gone! Dhoni tried to pinch one more to backward point, ran it too close to the fielder and the throw rifled in to catch Jadeja a couple of inches short
banged in, length in the corridor outside off, slides past the outside edge
full length outside off and this goes, in to the crowd at deep cover! A brutal smear from Dhoni, skipped forwards and cracked it way back over the rope. That's his fifty - the T20 Blood God awakens
six more, down the ground! Watson delivers it in the slot again and Dhoni pounces, huge forearms pumping as he levers another mighty over long-off
Watson goes around the wicket, low full toss and miscued into the midwicket area
beaten in the channel, nothing shot from Ashwin, trying to fiddle one to third man, misses
short ball from Watto, the batsman was ready, uppercuts to third man, in the air but lands safely and gets Dhoni back on strike
very full again, digs it out into the covers for a single
angled across, Johnson takes the pace off it, chopped into the covers
short and clipped off the hips through square
stays in the crease and punches one through a gap in the covers
fullish outside off, Dhoni squirts it away through cover point, had gone deep in the crease, another slower ball, I think
good line from Johnson, asking the batsman to take the risk, steered through the covers
full and outside off, flicked away in front of point for another single - they've seen off Johnson (2-50) but still need more than 100 from the last six
short delivery, possibly slower and Dhoni pulls hard and fails to connect
drops short again, this time regular pace, swings across the line and picks out deep square leg
Starc unleashes a beamer, wide of the stumps and Ashwin coolly steers it to third man - no-ball called, not a free hit, though

gone, Dhoni is run out by a direct hit from Maxwell, that's all, folks! Dhoni heads straight off, head bowed, nothing even India's supernatural finisher could do about this. He'd worked the singles hard, flicked this off his legs to midwicket and let probability have a go - Maxwell only had one stump to aim at but he dead-eyed it, Dhoni didn't even bother to dive, he was that far out
back of a length, speared across the batsman, who stays back and fishes unsuccessfully
fired through at nearly 90mph, past the outside edge once again
on the stumps, gets in line and pushes one into a gap
good length outside off, slightly slower and it slips past the outside edge
another cutter in the channel, Ashwin gets back on this one
length, outside off, dabs and misses again. Oh dear
bowled him, done for lack of pace and zing go the bails! Faulkner was carted around at the start of the innings but he's come back well, gets the legcutter on target and Ashwin plays all around it
another, Faulkner hits the stumps again! Two in two, India's time is almost up. Popped it on a length, slightly wobbly medium pace and Mohit played it like a stick of Kryptonite
full, too full and Umesh  blocks it steadfastly on the front foot
around the wicket, pitched up outside off, edged and it bobbles between keeper and slip, third man cleans up
yow, that has clanged Umesh on the helmet grill. No mercy from the Australians, Starc banged it in, rising with lethal intent, deflected off the glove and into his chin
short and wide this time, Umesh stays clear
length around off, goes for the big booming drive and doesn't connect

full and straight and Umesh is castled, too good for a No. 11. Australia win by 95 runs and go through to the World Cup final, India, the defending champions, lose their title as well as an 11-match unbeaten run
